means: <贬>（演讲者或演讲）油腔滑调的

sentence.Network_en: Many of these killers are frequently glib and superficially charming.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些杀手中，多数都是能说会道、外表迷人。

sentence.Network_en: Mr. Lewis takes an insufferably glib attitude toward it all.
sentence.Network_cn: 刘易斯先生对这一切不以为意，令人厌恶。

sentence.Network_en: His glib talk sounds as sweet as a song.

list.exp: 油腔滑调耍嘴皮子的人
list.abs: 油嘴_百度百科 ... [spray nozzle] 喷嘴 [glib talker] 油腔滑调耍嘴皮子的人 [glib] 说话油滑,善于狡辩.
glib arguments , excuses , etc., 诡辩的论据 , 藉口等.
赛马小报/racing form三寸不烂之舌/glib tongue三伏天/dog days
The fellow has a very glib tongue ., 这家伙嘴油得很.
a glib response to a complex question ., 对一复杂问题作出即兴回答.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (also in the sense 'smooth, unimpeded'): ultimately of Germanic origin; related to Dutch 'slippery' and German glibberig 'slimy'

entry.def: If you describe what someone says as glib, you disapprove of it because it implies that something is simple or easy, or that there are no problems involved, when this is not the case.

example.tran: 对“昔日苦难”的轻描淡写

example.ex: Mr. Lewis takes an insufferably glib attitude toward it all.
example.tran: 刘易斯先生对这一切不以为意，令人厌恶。

means.word_mean: 1. marked by lack of intellectual depth;

sentences.sentence: "a glib response to a complex question"

auth_sentence.content: The reviewer's glib dismissal missed the mark.
auth_sentence.res_content: The reviewer's glib dismissal missed the mark.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The reviewer's glib dismissal missed the mark.

auth_sentence.content: The snow lies glib as glass and hard as steel.
auth_sentence.res_content: The snow lies glib as glass and hard as steel.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The snow lies glib as glass and hard as steel.

auth_sentence.content: In his weaker work, this trope can seem glib and schematic.
auth_sentence.res_content: In his weaker work, this trope can seem glib and schematic.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In his weaker work, this trope can seem glib and schematic.

means.word_mean: <贬>(演讲者或演讲)油腔滑调的;不诚恳的;未经思考的;肤浅的
